org.apache.edgent.analytics.math3

Class Aggregations

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.edgent.analytics.math3.Aggregations

  • public class Aggregations
extends Object
    Apache Common Math analytics for Collections.

    These operations are typically used when processing a collection of tuples in a non-partitioned or partitioned TWindow.

    Simple sum aggregation functions are also provided (helpful given the avoidance of depending on Java8 Streams).

    Example: compute a batched MEAN aggregation for a simple unpartitioned window of numeric TStream<Double> where the desired result is a TStream<Double> of the MEAN values: 

    
  TStream<Double> pressureReadings = ...
TWindow<Double,Integer> window = pressureReadings.last(5, Functions.unpartitioned());
TStream<Double> meanPressureReadings = window.batch(
      (list, partition) -> Aggregations.aggregate(list, Statistic2.MEAN));

    Example: compute the MEAN and SLOPE, capturing the results in a ResultMap: 

    
  TStream<Double> pressureReadings = ...
TWindow<Double,Integer> window = pressureReadings.last(5, Functions.unpartitioned());
TStream<ResultMap> meanPressureReadings = window.batch(
      (list, partition) -> Aggregations.aggregateN(list, Statistic2.MEAN, Regression2.SLOPE));

    Example: compute multiple aggregations on multiple variables in a tuple T, capturing the results in a MvResultMap: 

    
class SensorReading { 
  double getTemp() {...};
  double getPressure() {...};
  ... };
TStream<SensorReading> readings = ...
TWindow<SensorReading,Integer> window = sensorReadings.last(5, Functions.unpartitioned());
TStream<MvResultMap> aggregations = window.batch(
      (list, partition) -> {
        ResultMap pressureResults = Aggregations.aggregateN(list, t -> t.getPressure(), Statistic2.MEAN, Regression2.SLOPE));
        ResultMap tempResults = Aggregations.aggregateN(list, t -> t.getTemp(), Statistic2.MAX));
        MvResultMap results = Aggregations.newMvResults();
        results.put("pressure", pressureResults);
        results.put("temp", tempResults);
        return results;
      });

    Example: convert a TStream<ResultMap> or TStream<MvResultMap> to a JsonObject: 

    
   TStream<ResultMap> resultMap = ...
 TStream<JsonObject> joResultMap = resultMap.map(ResultMap.toJsonObject());

    Background: JsonAnalytics predates this class. Use of JsonAnalytics for computing Apache Commons Math aggregations requires:

    • the input stream tuple type must be a JsonObject and the user must identify the property that contains the value to be aggregated.
    • batched window aggregations are not supported (they could be added).
    • the aggregation result tuple is a JsonObject that holds a user-specified property for a window partition key and a user-specified property for a JsonObject holding the UnivariateAggregation results by name (e.g., "MEAN"). Accessing a particular aggregation results in the JsonObject is somewhat cumbersome.

    As a result, using JsonAnalytics for simple cases can be a bit unintuitive and cumbersome.

    For example, to JsonAnalytics for a simple case of a continuous aggregation of TStream<Double> => TStream<Double> of MEAN values: 

    
  TStream<Double> pressureReadings = ...
 
 // transform TStream<Double> to TStream<JsonObject>
 TStream<JsonObject> joPressureReadings = pressureReadings.map(JsonFunctions.valueOfDouble("pressure"));
 
 // aggregate
 TWindow<JsonObject,JsonElement> window = joPressureReadings.last(5, JsonFunctions.unpartitioned());
 TStream<JsonObject> results = JsonAnalytics.aggregate(window, "partition", "pressure", Statistic.MEAN);
  
 // transform to TStream<Double> mean results
 TStream<Double> meanPressureReadings = results.map(jo -> jo.get("pressure").getAsObject().get("MEAN").getAsDouble());

    Using Aggregations it's simply: 

    
TWindow<Double,Integer> window = pressureReadings.last(5, Functions.unpartitioned());
TStream<Double> meanPressureReadings = window.aggregate(
      (list, partition) -> Aggregations.aggregate(list, Statistic2.MEAN));
    See Also:
    Statistic2, Regression2, JsonAnalytics

      • Aggregations

    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public static Double sum(Collection<? extends Number> list)
        Perform a sum of numbers treated as double values, accumulating in a double. An empty list yields a 0.0 result.
        Parameters:
        list - numbers to sum
        Returns:
        the sum

      • sumInts

        public static long sumInts(Collection<? extends Number> list)
        Perform a sum of numbers treated as long values, accumulating in a long. More efficient than sum() for non-floating point values. An empty list yields a 0 result.
        Parameters:
        list - numbers to sum
        Returns:
        the sum

      • aggregate

        public static Double aggregate(Collection<? extends Number> c,
                               UnivariateAggregate aggregate)
        Perform the specified UnivariateAggregate on a Collection of Number.

        A null result is returned if the collection is empty. An aggregation result may be null under other conditions, e.g., a Regression2.SLOPE where the minimum number of samples has not been met.

        Parameters:
        c - the Collection to aggregate
        aggregate - the aggregation to perform
        Returns:
        the aggregation result, may be null.

      • aggregateN

        public static ResultMap aggregateN(Collection<? extends Number> c,
                                   UnivariateAggregate... aggregates)
        Perform the specified UnivariateAggregate on a Collection of Number.

        If the collection is empty an empty ResultMap is returned. The ResultMap does not contain an entry for an aggregation with a null, e.g., a Regression2.SLOPE where the minimum number of samples has not been met.

        Parameters:
        c - the Collection to aggregate
        aggregates - the aggregations to perform
        Returns:
        a ResultMap containing the variable's aggregation results

      • aggregate

        public static <T> Double aggregate(Collection<T> c,
                                   ToDoubleFunction<T> getter,
                                   UnivariateAggregate aggregate)
        Perform the specified UnivariateAggregate a Collection of T using the specified getter to extract the variable to aggregate.

        A null result is returned if the collection is empty. An aggregation result may be null under other conditions, e.g., a Regression2.SLOPE where the minimum number of samples has not been met.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Tuple type
        Parameters:
        c - the Collection to aggregate
        getter - function that returns the variable to aggregate from a T
        aggregate - the aggregation to perform
        Returns:
        the aggregation result, may be null.

      • aggregateN

        public static <T> ResultMap aggregateN(Collection<T> c,
                                       ToDoubleFunction<T> getter,
                                       UnivariateAggregate... aggregates)
        Perform the specified UnivariateAggregate a Collection of T using the specified getter to extract the variable to aggregate.

        If the collection is empty an empty ResultMap is returned. The ResultMap does not contain an entry for an aggregation with a null, e.g., a Regression2.SLOPE where the minimum number of samples has not been met.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Tuple type
        Parameters:
        c - the Collection to aggregate
        getter - function that returns the variable to aggregate from a T
        aggregates - the aggregations to perform
        Returns:
        a ResultMap containing the variable's aggregation results
